title: Dynamic queue and the future of League

replies.body: Hey guys. Thanks for being transparent. One thing though, if this is going to be a video to demonstrate how professional you are (which it is...), keep the language to the minimum. You expect the same of public content of your casters and players, there is no reason the same can't be done for a video Riot produces for the playerbase.

It was in a more relaxed environment, it wasn't a planned out video it was a round table discussion. I would prefer this over something "Professional" any day, it feels like they are talking to me and not just reading from a prepared script.

To me the language they used was perfect, saying the word "fucked" has not meaning without the context its used in.

the word by itself cant be categorized as good or bad until you add the surrounding context.

they used the most aggressive term they could to illustrate how they have messed up and all that did for me is make me thing "wow they really realize that they have issues with the system"

saying "we fucked up" is not bad language just showing the intensiveness of the situation.

saying "your a fucking idiot" is bad language because of the context of the phrase.

good job riot i look forward to more videos of real discussions, it makes me believe you actually care, acknowledge the issues and are working towards them.
To clarify here, I'm not offended by the language, I just think if you're going to have a standard on your content, that you stick to it.

Why not for higher elo doing a cross server play. Like combining certain regions as they were in the past. Would allow for you guys to have more people and essentially help solve most of the problems for que times.

Maybe like after a certain amount of time in que it resorts to it.

I coming from an OCE region, would say that could become annoying. Our region is the only chance we have of having competitive ping and internets speeds to server. For America this is more reasonable, maybe even in Europe bu maybe not some of the other regions.

OCE players used to play on the NA server pre season 3...
Some had the elo equivalent to diamond players.
It's a viable option.

Playing 5v5 isn't the most frustrating issue for me (1 in 1000). The real issue is when you play with 4 premade teammates. They are almost always on Skype and have a majority vote. No communication and no say in FF vote. It gets really frustrating. The gaming experience is often unbearable at best.

I read the first 2 paragraphs and watched the first 45 seconds of the video and realise what I have been stating since the dynamic queue came in and what I have been stating since the start of S6, Riot does not give any thought to the low ELO community, period.

All this is just smoke and mirrors on their quest to cater to the same crowd they have been catering to for as long as they have had competitive competitions, that being the high ELO players. They have never really cared for low ELO, now that they are sticking permanently with the dynamic queue and the team rewards, along with no change as to how easy it is to get into ranked, they are pretty much forcing players to either get queued with bad players, or make a team.

I seen a post a couple of days ago that someone with a level 28 account was asking for advice, for enough as he is only level 28, he has only been playing for a few weeks, maybe months at best. 2 more levels and all he has to do from there is purchase the minimum required champions and head straight into ranked, no questions asked, no test to show he is capable of actually performing in ranked, or performing at all, and Riot just lets them join the 'highest skill' level queue like it is nothing.

I get why you are doing this, your high ranked players stream, join your competitive competitions and generally get more players joining and therefore more of an income which you need, but eventually all the players who get stuck in low ELO long enough will just end up leaving and there will be no one left to join your game and spend money, unless that is your plan, get as many new players as you can join to spend as much money as they can as soon as possible and not plan on having them stick around.

You quoted above **_"We know the dynamic ranked experience has been painful for the highest skilled players for the last few months. We remain focused on improving it and agree the current state is unacceptable."_**. From what I read on your post, there is almost no mention about how it is for low ELO players.

_**High MMR adjustments
High MMR queue times
Solos, duos, and trios battle a five-player premade**_

Those are not the issues, if you are good enough to play at high ranked, almost all the players at high ranked should be able to play well together, whether regardless of premades or solo, or anything in between.

The main issue we are facing is not high ranked, it is low ranked and how matchmaking matches your MMR. That is if your personal MMR is 1000 and you join a 4 man premade, your team mate will be MMR let's say 1500 and in the extreme case if you get matched against 5 solo players, they will also be 1500 MMR. In a 1v1 situation the 4 man premade on average will have ZERO chance to win. The problem here is that the first 10 minutes or so IS 1v1 or 2v2 with at least one roamer.

I have matched against premades before, completely smashed their mid or top laner like they were nothing but bots and by the time the team fighting starts or on of their team was able to roam, it was too late. Most notably I have been Nasus top and around the 15 minute mark pushing second tower with 4 enemy players _trying_ to defend, and losing. The enemy top laners MMR was that much lower than mine that in lane, in a 1v1 fight, they stood NO CHANCE and by the time the rest of the team tried to defend, I was able to hold of 4 of them at once. Whether I got kills or or took towers is not an issue, the fact I held 4 of them in one lane allowed my team mates to have a virtual 4v1 situation, therefore taking free CS and towers in the other lanes.

The same goes the other way, I have been matched with premades and they fall in much the same way. 2 games ago I had a premade mid/ADC/support. My top lane opponent was 6/0 while I was 1/2 and apparently it was all my fault she got fed and the reason we lost our game, nothing mentioned about our premade bot lane going a combined 2/16 for the game. Or the best one ever, getting matched with a 4 man premade. I got some 40 kills, they got 5 combined and were well and truly out of their league, I got the same loss and same LP loss that they did.

Even a simply 2 man premade in a match with 8 solo players will stand that much less chance to win in ANY queue at any skill level or rank, but more so at low level given that players down the dumps don't play as aggressively, roam as early or care as much as they do at top ranks, nor are they able to even defend as well and therefore when players do start to roam, it is too late.

Last game I played, SIX MINUTES into the game I noted we are going to lose, 8 minutes in we already lost the first bot lane tower, 4 minutes later with the enemy ADC in the top lane, we lost that tower, and that was all she wrote. In that game the enemy mid and top were premade, our bot and jungle were premade. I was hard countered top Nasus Vs. Panth, yet if not for Ashe I would have won my lane. Our bot lane asked in champ select "Can I go top?" some 5 seconds into champ select, and failed in game. A premade/solo (and the ADC being the important role in bot lane), vs. 2 solo players, who did you think would win that lane? The 2 solo players, their own personal MMR would have been higher than the solo/premade player and it was evident by them losing the tower only 8 minutes in.

TL;DR - There needs to be a change to MM/MMR at lower ranks up to a point. There needs to be some data collected and some testing done to prove what I am about to say.

Up to a point in ranked, the MMR needs to be matched SOLO VS. SOLO, regardless of whether the player is premade or not, it needs to take YOUR OWN MMR and match against other players WITH THE SAME SOLO MMR. Since you don't want to put the solo queue back in, you need to stop boosting premades MMR at low rank and just let them fight. Quite a fair few low ranked players only join teams with the assumption that they will win easier, or have only just joined a team and don't actually know how to play well together to be able to benefit from being in a team and therefore, simply get matched against players whose are able to win in the critical lane phase that much easier that no matter how well you group after that, it is too late.

Firstly, before you starting having shots at riot i believe you should look at your recent games, look at what the meta is and go from there
rather than:
1) blaming your team mates because of the possibilities of the dynamic que and because your premade team lost due to role selection.
2) looking towards whats meta and what youre building and building against the team youre versing rather than building the same items (ive looked at your history)
3) blaming riots MMR/and match making system, and people who get into rank straight up regardless of skill level is a thing solo que players or players of ranked have been have dealing with for years.
personally for me who started off in the same league as you (S4) to now climbing to (Plat4) due to looking at the meta and dealing with teams based on builds i believe that is a way to progress rather than complaining on a forum.

Heyo! 
For high ELO games, you mentioned that you would try to tune back the priority on role selection, possibly even giving some players a third role they didn't chose.

I wonder how this will affect LCS players, or challenger players. They have quiet literally no interest in playing any other role than their main role, and the only place for them to practice ingame mechanics is dynamic queue.

So summing up I feel like being more lenient on roles might be bad for the top tier of competitive players.

P.S.: I think it's great that you share what is going on inside Riot's decision making. This is great to help players understand the current state of the game.

Glad you liked it!

The main reason we are making that change for high mmr players is because of the queue times. Due to the nature of high mmr (being the top <1% of players) there will always be way fewer players there compared to the rest of the mmr levels.

When we added Role selection, this added another layer that matchmaking had to take into account before finding the right game for players. Right now it needs to do 3 things

1) Find a fair match, in terms of overall MMR
2) AND have players on one of 2 roles they picked
3) AND have players in similar group numbers
The longer the queue time went on 1) and 3) would get worse and worse. Matches would get less fair in terms of MMR spread and groups would not be similar.

This compounded with the low population at high MMR means two things happen;

1) Queue times are significantly higher
2) groups of 1-3 vs groups of 5 happen more frequently

"1 in 1000 from bronze to plat compared to 1 in 150 from Diamond +"

"We’re going to intentionally make a trade-off here: Scale back on guaranteeing specific roles in order to better ensure high quality matches get made in a reasonable amount of time."

So TL;DR is High MMR players have been complaining a long time about high queue times. We are putting in Auto fill mode which removes some control they have over their role select to ensure they get fair matches in shorter times.

Awww will you look at that, Riot are saying something on probably the ONLY post here of someone who said they like the new queues, and now I have a chance to reply to a Rioter, which will no doubt either be deleted or ignored.

First, let me rant, than I will be nice and explain.

YOUR DYNAMIC QUEUE SUCKS HARDER THAN A HOOKER ON CRACK! In ALL the previous seasons I have played, NEVER EVER have I had games that are so bad, never have I had issues where I feel the need to come here after ALMOST EVERY GAME and post some nonsensical crap to try and get my point across, the dynamic queue DOES NOT WORK! And looking at all the posts here, most of the players feel the same way.

I have been stating since the start of S6, this queue system is being rubbish, will not and is not working and you must, yes, MUST implement a way to allow players to gain and lose LP based on YOUR OWN PERSONAL GAME, give players a real fucking incentive to actually play ranked, to play this game and to actually try to win rather than doing what I do. I no longer play for real after a certain point in the game, I just fuck about whether I am going to win or lose, I see the game is over one way or another and so far, EVERY SINGLE GAME I have played in S6 since my first 10 games I have called each and every single one of them as to who is going to win and got it right.

Most recently I almost pulled a Nasus split push, took down 2 whole lanes and both nexus towers on my own and got within 2 hits of the nexus, well, 2 Nasus hits. When one of my team tried the same approach, they got as close as the inhibitor and died miserably. As close as I got to winning that game, I was still right from the very beginning, we will lose and we did.

OK, rant over, let me try and be nice.

Out of all honesty that I can possibly muster for this game, I will be 100% in saying this season is by FAR worse than every other season I have played. I spend more time on these boards posting than I do even playing. I have previously made it to Gold and better with nothing more than Teemo top lane, I finished that season on Gold.

Your old system was a little better than this system, but I have noted in the past that NO system that implements a chess like MMR rating will ever work 100% when there is more than one player on each team, it just cannot happen, ever. Mathematically there is no way of doing it, trust me on that, please. I may sound crazy, but when it comes to numbers, I know what I am talking about.

What you need to do, something I have suggested way in the past and something I keep posting now since the start of this season, the start of dynamic queue and the introduction of team rewards. You CANNOT give more rewards to premade players, you will only force players to make groups just to get those rewards and this is probably the reason you have the rewards, to force players to group, and than with the increased 'premade teams' you can use those stats to back yourselves and say it is all working and it only needs some fine tuning.

I can almost guarantee you that without the team rewards you will have far less players grouping. I have never seen so many premades in this game, and the majority of them are bad. It used to be in the past, the team who had the better premade wins. Now it is whoever has the worst premade loses. I am not even the one who first said that, I am stealing it from someone else, and it is true, you get 3+1+1 vs. 3+1+1, whoever is the worst 3 man premade, loses the game.

_**You MUST implement a system that gauges YOUR OWN PLAY and gives you an LP gain or loss based on that, not on whoever wins. **_It was a jackpot to begin with, now with the boosted MMR matches being more evident, you are only giving players worse games. Yes, you can have the same chance of getting a bad team than others, but lets face it and lets look deeper into it. What you need to research on is this: How many premade teams are winning when you premake a team more than a certain percentage?

That is, You get all the stats on premade teams, look at how many times the same players are premaking teams, let's say I premake a team with the same 8-10 players for over half my ranked games, how many wins do I have against someone who has only 'premade' a team with random players for most of their ranked games? You may be surprised and see that those who just randomly take whoever to premade vs. those who premade with the same players don't actually win anymore game, I know this as I have been through it, take some random dude who played one good game, than lose the next three and realise they only played that one good game when you bother to check on their history.

I have played in ONE good premade team this season and only a handful over the time I have been playing. Since I don't have any real life friends who play this game, I cannot get into a rhythm with the same players and build some team skills, or get players who play the same way I do. You don't really have an option to find players who can play well with you.

I take you back to my WoW days. You join a Guild, you find X number of players who you play well with who are on at the same times you are, and viola, you start to do well in both PVE and PVP, why, because you can talk to them regularly outside the instances and get to know them as people therefore making it more worthwhile to try and do well each and everything and go above and beyond for them, rather than, as someone said, see them as a commodity that you will only trade up when you find someone better.

I had some 15 players on my friends list this season, that is down to none since most of those players were either not on when I was, never accepted an invite, or only played 1-2 roles / champions good a handful of times and overall made my gaming experience worse since I was in an MMR boosted premade team and when I went against someone who wasn't premade, they personally were at a higher MMR than I was, making life difficult.

The only time premades REALLY work is when it is 5v5, because the boosted MMR is, not really boosted since you are all premade. The moment you get one person singled out, game over. But I bring you to the attention of one, if not THE best game I have ever played. Some time ago I chose Yi jungle, got grouped with a 4 man premade, can't remember the enemy comp, but let me tell you they sucked BALLS. I got some 40+ kills and less deaths than all of my team, close to 1 million damage and 250K player damage, but still lost, why? The enemy team was better than the four I was playing with.

I am thinking the old system took my personal ELO, matched with the 4 of them, averaged both teams ELO to be the same and I was personally that much better than the entire enemy team and smashed them, but because the other 4 on my team were that much lower ELO than the enemy were on a personal ELO that they just couldn't keep up and I couldn't virtually take on 5 players solo.

As I said being the third person to post on this earlier today:
> Up to a point in ranked, the MMR needs to be matched SOLO VS. SOLO, regardless of whether the player is premade or not, it needs to take YOUR OWN MMR and match against other players WITH THE SAME SOLO MMR. Since you don't want to put the solo queue back in, you need to stop boosting premades MMR at low rank and just let them fight. Quite a fair few low ranked players only join teams with the assumption that they will win easier, or have only just joined a team and don't actually know how to play well together to be able to benefit from being in a team and therefore, simply get matched against players whose are able to win in the critical lane phase that much easier that no matter how well you group after that, it is too late.

Or you implement this: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Jhxwn6yi-MgSEbO2F-J-rq5EWxZM8ujr4W3o3S36vgs/edit?usp=sharing

A system that allows players to gain and lose ELO based on their play. It gives those who can actually play a real chance to rank up and those who just tag along for the ride, to rank down, putting players where they personally belong. It also gives you a REAL reason to give 100% in each and every game, even those where 4 of your team rage quit. Yes, that has happened to me. It was quite hilarious actually being in a real 1v5 match. But for that what did I get? The same as the rest of my team, the same LP lose that the 4 quitters got. You tell me, how is that fair?

I can go through each and every game in my list and tell you exactly why I built the way I built, why I got the score I got, actually I will answer that for you now, it is almost the same answer each time. I build to counter my lane to give me an advantage, allow me to farm more, get more kills, win my lane, STOP MY OPPONENT and therefore give my team the best possible chance to win, but when my team fail, like losing towers under 10 minutes, or feeding hard, I try to build what we are missing. That is, if the ADC is rubbish, I start to build more damage to try and compensate for them not doing any. But I can still go through each game and tell you WHY I did what I did in that particular game and why we lost and prove to you that in most of them it was not anything I done to make us lose.

I will give you one example on my last game. Our designated 'mid' decided to take jungle and screw over our actual jungle who had to take mid or else, we could try 2 jungle and no mid, it may have been better than what was to come. Bot lane had a Garen 'Support' who ended up taking CS and A> Built no boots and B> played like he was a fully farmed top laner. 99% of his games are Garen, Trynd, Renekton or Xin and this was his FIRST ranked game, about 130 for me. Just more proof that players join ranked for shits and giggles with no real understanding or enough skill to play ranked. To top it off, he had previous games with someone of the name LCD****, in this game he was grouped first time I can see with someone named LCD****, same first 3 initials. You know what that means? I know you do.

I am out of characters here, you know what I mean with the above, I know you do, but you all refuse to listen. Why?

I personally don't agree with you. While it might be true that you feel the ranked experiences has gotten worse for you, this does not apply to the majority of players.

In the video Socrates (I think it was him) stated that there is far less toxicity than during the previous year, and that many more players approach rankeds. Furthermore they also gave us the statistics for matches being against 5 man premades (1/1000).

Taking these statistics as true and the experience my friends and I had, I think the state of dynamique queue in lower elo is fine. Personally I have not had extremely one sided matches, where I felt it was their TEAMPLAY winning and not simply their mechanical superiorness (howering in low plat).
yo omni the game is only always "over" cos you act like a little bitch instead of fighting to your last breath.

Yeh no, look at my last game, I fought the best I could to the end, get a lousy S rank and no thanks to my team I get a loss the same as them. Yet AGAIN bot lane on the enemy side get fed no thanks to our shitty support, AGAIN my bot lane fails for like the 100th time this SEASON alone.

I will re-iterate what I generally say, I have no issues in all other game modes, why is that? By now anyone who has played this game long enough should know, my personal MMR in other game modes is high enough to be matched with players of my skill.

Whereas in ranked, no matter how well you play, because you need to rely on your team to do something, even if that is not feeding and just defend, you have more chance to be stuck at a lower rank. Players who join ranked do so WAY to early and generally suck ass.

Look again at wrote at the very end, a fresh level 30 playing their first ranked game, going as a support with Garen, stealing CS and building a decent top lane build minus the boots. I still tried in that game, even though I knew it was over before it even began, I still fought hard and I knew what was coming in game. Garen stealing CS from our AD, our AD inevitably feeding and cursing on their own team, showing nothing more than how immature and bad they are that rather than play smart, they continue to play a one track game and blame the team.

> [{quoted}](name=Omni Presents,realm=OCE,application-id=pEj6Ee6n,discussion-id=miEAtXcc,comment-id=00060000000000010000,timestamp=2016-06-06T11:41:56.303+0000)
>
> Yeh no, look at my last game, I fought the best I could to the end, get a lousy S rank and no thanks to my team I get a loss the same as them. Yet AGAIN bot lane on the enemy side get fed no thanks to our shitty support, AGAIN my bot lane fails for like the 100th time this SEASON alone.
> 
> I will re-iterate what I generally say, I have no issues in all other game modes, why is that? By now anyone who has played this game long enough should know, my personal MMR in other game modes is high enough to be matched with players of my skill.
> 
> Whereas in ranked, no matter how well you play, because you need to rely on your team to do something, even if that is not feeding and just defend, you have more chance to be stuck at a lower rank. Players who join ranked do so WAY to early and generally suck ass.

> Look again at wrote at the very end, a fresh level 30 playing their first ranked game, going as a support with Garen, stealing CS and building a decent top lane build minus the boots. I still tried in that game, even though I knew it was over before it even began, I still fought hard and I knew what was coming in game. Garen stealing CS from our AD, our AD inevitably feeding and cursing on their own team, showing nothing more than how immature and bad they are that rather than play smart, they continue to play a one track game and blame the team.

sorry man I don't mean to pick on you the you are like me (on the days I don't just get mad and give up =/) this game is losing its interest from me and I just find myself mucking around rather than trying because in the end you can win the game just by pushing a few enemy towers if u are ahead or behind 5000 gold no matter. All that matters is what you say, a team who knows only how to defend and not feed, then one person can carry that game.

Thanks for your answer,

Yes I understood the base problem. You can't go for one of the three goals without giving up something on the other side. As GBay99 said though, the priority for him is on role selection, and I think this is the case for most of LCS, Challenger or College Team players.

I am thinking about the scenario where queue times would be 5 minutes short and matches would be balanced, but would this make the above mentioned players happy if they could only play their main role say 33% of the time?

Maybe you could allow Master and Challenger players to participate in a survey where they can answer the same question. How would you rate these three factors? And then act accordingly.

P.S.: Mind I am talking refering to high elo players. I think the state for dynamic queue in lower elo is fine.. I find my games to be less toxic and I am still howering about the same elo as in the last 2 years.
5 minute average que times for diamond? With respect, that's a complete load of horse poo
I love the fact that I was able to watch this entire video whilst I was in q and I didn't find a game for another 15 minutes after...
'play premade or too bad' I guess that's how it is. Who needs Individual skill right? Certainly not a game based on skill!
That doesn't make any sense and you know it. A bronze premade is still bronze, skill is what this game is all about and it always will be.

These people talking from riot's perspective are so utterly blind.
When they ask questions about "What is you mean by 'fair'" just describes so obviously that nobody making decisions has actually any idea what's happening. It's like the player's idea of fair and the idea of fair from the designers perspective is so different.

"Finding two teams who are closely matched to each other.. You're not going to be able to do that all the time. So the second order is we have to start matching 5's with duos or 3's"
Just stop right there. Just don't do it.
This way of thinking is stupid, and nigh embarrassing. Why is it that we have to preserve a system that cannot match teams all the time, when we had a system previously that was by design able to match these much easier, because it had less criteria to match! It's like you can't see the forest for the trees.
It feels like preserving dynamic queue is at some higher order of priority than the stage in which it's set.
The argument is never going to be "solo queue versus dynamic queue" because dynamic queue has this higher favor that automatically defeats solo queue regardless of the arguments on which they stand individually.

Then we come to the idea that the dread scenario is that you're a solo player versus a team of five players, that the match making system is at it's worst then.
The reality is, is that matching against even three or four people is going to be just as bad, not because they camp your lane and you have a shitty game, but because this advantage that comes from being a group is not in the spirit of the queue that should be competitive.

Let me be precise when i say this.
Making friends with the best guy on your team when you solo queue and inviting him to queue with you again is not a game we should start playing.
It leads to treating people as a commodity. Like trading cards, where you discard the worst for the new best one you've picked up.


Finally, after all of this, the idea that playing with my friends is the best way to play.
I hate ranked with my friends.
I don't want that.
I want a system that matches me with equally good players in an environment that has NOTHING to do with prearranged groups of people.
I want communication and team play to be a skill that is developed and expressed through working with people you might have never met and might never meet again.

I'm not going to be playing ranked again.
And playing league seems like a waste without it.

"Hey Sam, get on Skype, we're deciding which line is for you." "Okay, I want top line, it's my best." "Sam, please be kind, you have butt locked on top for 3 games,Jayson wants it so bad this time." "........." Go to hell premade!!!!

They should do a few live streams where they get to talk to the community (NA, OCE etc) and have sensible people join in on the conversation and listen to people and compromise. For example NA does a live stream, NA players regardless of rank could join, given they are sensible and give ideas and options which would not just benefit themselves but benefits the whole game in general, because from recent research, people lose the emotional attachment reading chat or updates, ie. i could be angry reading the update and mis-interpret the text etc. just a thought thats all, OH AND FIX THE QUEUES :P and MMR ty :)
are you kidding ive been waiting 10 minutes plus for bronze games
if you stop solo que, 85% of ppl dont have ppl to party up with. i for one am new to the game. i gaurentee you will lose alot of player if you stop it
.... why take away solo q.. its bullshit.. now all you get if you solo q is a bunch of premade tryhards and its stupid.. good job.. another shit decision made by you.

Having removed solo q as a format is the single dumbest thing the companyhas done; the introduction of dynamic queue has undermined the mmr/elo system and u have adjusted the game to suit the majority of ppl who wlould otherwise never get out of low elo hell without the aid of premade teams stomping soloQ players. Scarra and the other streamer r trying to explain this to representatives of a company who frankly have no idea what the status of elo is supposed to represent becos they are at best silver league players with no time to play the game in most cases and dont understand the struggle or the high work rate required to achieve high mmr, only to have it undermined by big groups of players manipulating the system to achieve similaar status THAT DOES NOT have the same value when it comes to individual knowledge and mechanics nor the maturity to respect individual prowess. TL;DR is this appealing to a broader range of masses and customers at the expense of quality gaming thru a lack of understanding and an inability to provide both soloq and team queue! GO lok at heroes of the storm who have both systems n u will understand why so many of the more skilled and mature ppl are swithing over.
the elo score mmr score, no longer has any meaning thanks to the premade and dynamic queue manipulating the system; creating poor quality matches in the name of faster queue times is a cop out!

Ultimate Solution for Dynamic Queue time issues, possibly a good idea to test at high elo then with success spread to low elo.

Match based off group size and mmr. As it is now groups match with solo players of higher mmr. 

REMOVE ROLES FROM MATCHMAKING EQUATION AGAIN WHILE STILL LETTING PLAYERS PICK ROLES. HOW? READ ON!

Once teams are matched, players have 30 seconds to pick three roles (or fill) in order of preference. This happens once you are in champion select, and your selection is hidden from other players until the 30 second period is over. If you do not select your roles the system will put fill as your preference.

From here there are two options:
1. Roles are decided based off the first in best dressed method - basically what happened between players in the old system
2. (This is better) a program works out the best way for everyone to get a role that they are happy with. 

Then go into the game :D

This solution is aimed at reducing Queue times while still allowing for role selection. Queue times should be drastically lower and role preference (while not top two) will still be considered. 

Tl;dr 
- New Matchmaking system that solves all discussed issues
1. Search for players BEFORE selecting roles
2. In champ select players have 30 seconds to select top three roles, in order of preference
3. A program works out a way for everyone to get one of their preferred roles if possible

Hi Riot,


I am an analyst and totally understand the queue time trade-off you guys have to make by running your matchmaking model over segmented player base (on tier, role, and ofc other factors). In fact I have experience on matchmaking algorithms over social media and have face similar issues myself. From my experience I believe that if you guys are using ML algos and can't come up with a solution then optimizing and end corrections ain't gonna solve it either, maybe fix it a little (10-20%, like putting a band aid). 



So, here is a new idea. Instead of asking me who I wanna play as, let me select who my team should be like based on my current mood.

{{summoner:4}} {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:4}}  

"**Allow me to choose my team based of Role preference, tier and potential toxicity, and correspondingly suffer the associated queue time to making my dream team**"
1. Consider each player currently in queue as a vector of (role, tier, toxicity). 
2. Show players to view the universe of players in queue and vote for who they want to select for their team.
3. Each vector has a "time score" associated with it, which means if i vote for 4 players with high skill, and exact roles which I don't want to take, then I will also be able to visually see how much time each player will add to my queue time.


Here is a example of it. Say I am a (Plat 1, Mid, Non toxic) player. When i queue, Riot shows me what are the available number of vectors (basically, the summarized view of all 'in-queue' players) based of the 3 dimensions above. So if i am feeling in a competitive mood, i will select the players sitting on the higher end of the distribution KNOWING the amount of time it will add to queue time. Similarly,since the number of players of my vector (Plat 1, Mid, Non toxic) will be very few in number, the "time score" associated with selecting me for a game will be quite high as well.

But, if i just wanna play for fun, don't care about role / toxicity / tier much, then i will select players who are ok with any role,are potential toxic, 1-2 tiers below me etc.

Just to add, a premade of 2, 3 will be considered as a single vector as well.

_**This type of model will allow the Player to VOTE for their own team while choosing whether they care about Skill Or Toxicity Or Role, or any of the above 3 in any subset size AND keeping in mind the queue time tradeoff they have to make for a better experience.**_

I will enjoy having a brainstorming session with someone from your team who sees value in such a system, just to refine the idea and make it more transparent. You can reach me at my registered email ID.

Give the masses the power to choose!!

GG

I'll be honest, I'm not a big League player, but I enjoy watching on Twitch and in my professional life I am involved in systems design... so here are my thoughts:

**Role selection**

I think if you focus on matchmaking as only an algorithm to get the right balance of queue times vs match quality vs role selection, you're missing an opportunity to motivate players to trying something they might not otherwise.

World of Warcraft has the "Call to Arms" reward, where playing an under-subscribed role gets you a reward; I think now that you have Hextech crafting, you can probably create a small opt-in reward for players who choose Support as a primary role during high queue times, and secondly as a consolation prize for people who get their second role (so if I've chosen Mid/Support, I still get the bonus; or if I've chosen Mid/Jungle and get Jungle, I get the bonus as well).

Something like this -- a small token to make players feel a bit better about missing out on their primary role would free you up to be a bit looser with role select so that the queue time and match quality are still really good.

**Premades**

As above, I think by enforcing 3-man maximums is missing out on an opportunity to motivate people.

I think a 'Premade protection' system should be put in place:

Queueing as a 3-man, 4-man or 5-man premade: Minutes 0-5: System looks for other groups of similar MMR that were premade (3/1/1, 3/2, 4/1 or 5). Minutes 5+: System continues looking for other groups of similar MMR, but makes them eligible to to be put into games against teams of higher MMR solo/duo players.

The 'protection' part is if the latter occurs: if the premade was put against a team of solo/duo players and wins, for their next game put them against even higher MMR solo/duo players. You are doing this already, but I think it should be raised exponentially until they lose (basically, it's a hidden 'premade' MMR). The goal here is to ensure players in premades lose 50% and win 50% of their games either because they're against equal MMR premades or because they're against exponentially-increasing MMR solo/duo players. The premade MMR need only be very temporary; 24 hours is enough to accommodate team membership changes (one player drops, another is added, but the premade still faces much higher MMR duo/solo opponents on that night if one or more members has a high premade MMR), but not so long as to prevent playing with one group of friends one night and another on another night.

This might not be very good consolation to the solo/duo players that get stomped until the premade MMR hits a decent place though, so I think solo/duo players that just lost to a premade should have a significantly reduced chance of coming up against premade teams the immediate game following (I'd go so far as to say they will never be queued against pre-mades two games in a row, and that doesn't seem unreasonable). Like the premade MMR, you don't want this to be a particularly long-lasting effect; the point is to encourage players to "get back on the horse" and have another game knowing that they're highly unlikely to be stomped in the next one. These players should also be prioritised in the queue system over players who have not been up against premades -- that is, their next game should start really quickly for preference, so that bad taste of defeat is gone quickly.

Note: at low MMR, solo/duo players *may* be put against premades for their first game, and there's no window where they can't be put against premades; you don't want people to game the system by dodging at a set time.

**High MMR**

Solo queuers do what they do now; choose two roles and, as above, you can reward those who choose under-subscribed roles or who get their secondary role choice.

Queueing duo, each person selects two roles they're willing to play, but those roles should not be in conflict (that is, a duo team needs four total roles -- two primary, two secondary, none in conflict). This gives your matchmaking system the widest option to get these players into a game and you can still reward players who choose under-subscribed roles or who get their secondary role choice when brought into a group (as above).

Queuing as a 3-man or 4-man, each player should have to select **one** role (no secondary) that does not conflict with others on the team. Then, the team should press a 'Looking for members' button that builds a 'party premade' *before* matchmaking commences; that is, the matchmaking system looks for solo/duo players to fill those slots. The party premade system allows players to talk strategy, share voice chat info etc before actually being thrown into champion select. This encourages the group leaders (the 3-man or 4-man that pulled the group together) to coordinate with the 'fill' player(s) knowing that they may be up against 5-man premade groups. It also gives the solo/duo players who have joined the larger group advanced notice what role they've been given and, if it's their second choice, a chance to discuss their strengths and weaknesses (they may be able to swap roles if the group is willing or, if not, they will have gone in with full knowledge).

Queuing as a 5-man premade is obviously straightforward as it is now; they've built together on the party screen anyway.

Importantly, in the matchmaking scenarios below, the preference is to make games from 5-mans, then party premades (3/1/1, 3/2, 4/1), then solo/duo players; the idea is to foster a higher level of competitive play from high MMR individuals.

**Matchmaking for high MMR solo/duo players**

Minutes 0-5 after pressing 'Play': System looks for 3-man or 4-man groups that are 'Looking for members' of around the same MMR (each minute progressively widens the MMR). System also starts pooling solo/duo players into teams of 5 and matches them against other teams made up of solo/duo players -- a game will launch if the latter is found while waiting on the former.

Minutes 5-10: System continues looking for valid 3-man/4-man groups, but also pools solo/duo players into teams of 5 and makes them eligible to be put into games against 5-man groups that were initially formed through the party screen (i.e. 3/1/1, 3/2 or 4/1). Note: the 'Premade protection' system above would be in effect here.

Minutes 10+: System continues looking for valid 3-man/4-man groups, but also pools solo/duo players into teams of 5 and makes them eligible to be put into games against 5-man premade groups (worst case scenario). Note: the 'Premade protection' system above would be in effect here.

**Matchmaking for high MMR 3-man and 4-man groups**

No time limit: System places these groups in 'Looking for members' status (MMR window progressively widens the longer it goes on). The longer a group is in queue, the higher its priority with pulling solo/duo players into the party (i.e. a 3-man group that has been in queue for 5mins has a higher priority to pull a solo player in that has a valid MMR, even if there was another 3-man group waiting that has a closer MMR to the solo player). Once the party is full and ready (after talking strategy, champions, voice chat, whatever), only then can the party leader press 'Play'.

Minutes 0-5: System looks for 5-man groups of similar MMR regardless of if they were established through the party (3/1/1, 3/2, 4/1) or 5-man premades (MMR window progressively widens).

Minutes 5+: System continues looking for 5-man groups, but makes this group eligible to be placed against teams comprised of solo/duo teams (who have been queueing for 5 minutes or more, as above).

**Matchmaking for high MMR 5-man premades**

Minutes 0-10: System looks for 5-man groups of similar MMR regardless of if they were established through the party (3/1/1, 3/2, 4/1) or 5-man premades (MMR window progressively widens).

Minutes 10+: System continues looking for 5-man groups (continuing to widen the MMR window), but makes this group eligible to be placed against teams comprised of solo/duo teams (who have been queueing for 10 minutes or more, as above).

Yay more 5 man premade ranked players against solo players.
Thanks.
